title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: North Korea stole a record amount of crypto—again: report estimates  its hackers’ 2025 haul at $2 billion
items.description: The country has now pilfered about $7 billion in crypto all-time.

items.title: Want a job in AI-era tech? Forget prestigious degrees—tech leaders want to see your GitHub projects and internships
items.description: As entry-level tech hiring slows, one CEO warns avoiding AI skills would be like “taking crazy pills”—and says Gen Z must show real proof of ability.

items.title: The American voter is angry about one thing above all and Trump’s tariffs are in the crossfire, Goldman’s chief political economist says
items.description: Cost of living is the issue driving the midterms. Trump calls affordability a "hoax" when Democrats say it, but his tariff regime is showing cracks.

items.title: AI governance becomes a board mandate as operational reality lags
items.description: Fortune 500 companies are racing to formalize AI oversight.

items.title: U.K. startup CellVoyant debuts AI platform that could radically reduce the cost of cell-based therapies such as CAR-T immunotherapy for cancer
items.description: CellVoyant says its FateView platform can reduce the cost of producing viable cells for therapy by up to 80%

items.title: Why Trump Media is getting into the nuclear business with a $6 billion deal
